sections.title: The open-source admin for your internal AI apps
sections.subtitle: Prototype in chat, ship in code, and run & monetize agentic apps in production.

sections.eyebrow: Control pannel for your AI stack
sections.title: AI demos are easy. Production isn't.
sections.description: DecoCMS bridges the gap between prompts and production. Connect your stack, govern every step, and deploy agentic apps with built-in observability, spend controls, and a marketplace to reuse or monetize your modules.

value.title: One place to build, run, and monetize your agents
value.subtitle: Govern access, trace every step, and turn reusable modules into paid products.

features.title: Connect your context
features.description: Unify data, tools and models with policy, RBAC and observability — your agents always get the right context, safely.

features.title: Govern & observe your runs
features.description: No vibe debugging: logs, traces, error analytics and cost-per-step to optimize quality and spend, with roles, approvals and tenancy.

features.title: Reuse & monetize with our marketplace
features.description: Install ready-made modules — or publish your own. Wallet-based per-run billing turns apps into revenue.

value.title: One platform, two surfaces
value.subtitle: Prototype in natural language. Scale in code.

sections.title: FAQs

faqItems.question: What is DecoCMS, and how is it different from other AI app builders?
faqItems.answer: DecoCMS is an open-source Context CMS — a control plane and runtime for building, running, and monetizing AI-powered agentic apps. Unlike traditional app builders, it unifies context, governance, observability, and monetization in one platform.

faqItems.question: Do I need to be a developer to use DecoCMS?
faqItems.answer: Not at all. Business teams can create prompts, workflows, and agents without writing code, while developers can extend, customize, and deploy advanced capabilities using our TypeScript SDK and CLI.

faqItems.question: How does DecoCMS handle governance and observability?
faqItems.answer: Every run is fully traced, auditable, and secure. DecoCMS includes role-based access control (RBAC), spend caps, error analytics, and per-step cost visibility — ensuring safe operations and compliance by default.

faqItems.question: Can I self-host DecoCMS or bring my own keys (BYOK)?
faqItems.answer: Yes. DecoCMS is open-source and fully portable. You can self-host it on your infrastructure, bring your own API keys, and maintain full control over your data and costs.

faqItems.question: Can I ensure my data stays private and secure when self-hosting DecoCMS?
faqItems.answer: Absolutely. When you self-host DecoCMS, your data, models, and keys stay fully under your control. DecoCMS never stores or transmits your data unless you explicitly configure it to.

faqItems.question: How much does DecoCMS cost?
faqItems.answer: You start with $2 in free credits — no credit card required. After that, pricing is usage-based, so you only pay per run, with full transparency and real-time cost tracking in your dashboard.

faqItems.question: How does the DecoCMS SDK work for developers?
faqItems.answer: The DecoCMS SDK lets you build, extend, and manage agents, workflows, and UIs in TypeScript. It integrates seamlessly with the CLI, enabling local development, testing, and edge deployment from a single codebase.

faqItems.question: What is the Context Mesh, and why is it important?
faqItems.answer: The Context Mesh is DecoCMS’s governed layer for connecting data, tools, and models. It provides typed connectors with built-in policy routing, RBAC, observability, and spend controls — ensuring the right context is delivered safely every time.

faqItems.question: Does DecoCMS support edge deployment?
faqItems.answer: Yes. DecoCMS ships agents, workflows, and UIs to the edge automatically, ensuring low latency and global performance by default. You can manage environments, preview builds, and deploy updates directly from the CLI.

faqItems.question: How does DecoCMS integrate with Git?
faqItems.answer: DecoCMS uses a Git-backed workflow by default. Every change to agents, workflows, and UIs is versioned, allowing you to branch, review, and merge updates just like any modern development stack. This ensures full traceability and safe collaboration between teams.
